data.title: Why Pivotal's Levine Has Turned Bearish on Facebook
data.text: Feb.11 -- Michael Levine, Pivotal Research Group analyst, explains why he lowered his rating to sell on Facebook Inc.

data.title: Big Tech keeps getting bigger, as antitrust inquiries continue to multiply
data.text: As they pile up astronomical profits and their market values balloon, tech giants are offering stark reminders of their growing dominance despite numerous investigations.

data.title: Facebook analyst who caused Tuesday's drop explains why he downgraded the stock
data.text: Michael Levine, the Facebook analyst who downgraded the stock Tuesday, told CNBC he is concerned about the continued growth of the social media giant's advertising business.

data.title: Stocks Slash Gains As FTC Probe Hits Facebook, Microsoft; Shopify Due
data.text: Stocks slash gains as FTC probe hits Facebook, Microsoft; Shopify earnings on tap.

data.title: Facebook analyst explains why he downgraded the stock, preceding its slide
data.text: Pivotal Research Group analyst Michael Levine said part of Facebook's advertising business "just feels very unsustainable."

data.title: Kara Swisher: FTC may not have staff to investigate all tech acquisitions
data.text: Recode executive editor Kara Swisher and Stuart Frankel's Steve Grasso discuss the Federal Trade Commission announcement it will examine prior acquisitions by Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Microsoft, with CNBC's "Closing Bell" team.

data.title: US orders Google, Facebook and others to reveal details of years of acquisitions
data.text: Federal Trade Commission says its focus on smaller company takeovers will help clarify antitrust investigations

data.title: WhatsApp Payments To Launch In India, BofA Says Monetization Will Take Time
data.text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) shares were reacting to multiple analyst updates in Tuesday's session.

data.title: Why this research analyst is downgrading Facebook
data.text: Pivotal Research downgrades Facebook.

data.title: F.T.C. Broadens Review of Tech Giants, Homing In on Their Deals
data.text: The agency ordered Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Alphabet and Microsoft to turn over a decade’s worth of information on small acquisitions.

data.title: 5 Top Stock Trades for Wednesday: AMZN, UAA, FB, FDX, HAS
data.text: Amazon, Under Armour, Facebook, FedEx and Hasbro were our top stock trades for Wednesday. That said, here's a look at the charts.

data.title: FTC Broadens Big Tech Antitrust Probe To 'Kill Zone'; Facebook Stock Slips
data.text: The FTC will review Big Tech acquisitions of smaller firms, known as a "kill zone," to determine whether they have hurt competition. Facebook stock slipped after a downgrade.

data.title: FTC to investigate ‘hundreds’ of past acquisitions made by Microsoft, Google, Apple, Amazon and Facebook
data.text: Antitrust regulators widened their investigatory net into the top of the technology industry Tuesday, including Microsoft Corp. for the first time.

data.title: FTC orders Apple, Google, other tech giants to hand over acquisition info
data.text: The commission says it wants to take a closer look at buyouts.

data.title: Is FB Stock Losing the Youth Game?
data.text: FB stock has some challengers, especially in the viable youth market. Still, Facebook is too much of a behemoth to take down.

data.title: FTC to examine every acquisition by Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Microsoft in 2010-2019 over antitrust issues
data.text: Companies like Apple, Amazon and Google do not always disclose every acquisition they make, especially when the companies in question are little fish in the tech big pond, but in aggregate, all that M&A could pose bigger questions about how they are using their financial power and market influence in anticompetitive ways.

data.title: Facebook suspends MWC plans due to coronavirus risk
data.text: Facebook joins Amazon, Sony, Intel, LG, Ericsson and Nvidia in deciding to forgo this year's show in Barcelona.

data.title: Facebook stock falls after Pivotal Research analyst turns bearish
data.text: Shares of Facebook Inc. FB, +0.34% are off 1% in premarket trading Tuesday after Pivotal Research Group analyst Michael Levine downgraded the stock to sell from hold and lowered his target price to $180 from $215.

data.title: Surprise! Millennials Still Love Facebook
data.text: Over two-thirds of this generation still use the social network on a daily basis.

data.title: Billionaire Peter Thiel Sells A Majority Of His Remaining Facebook Stake
data.text: Billionaire investor Peter Thiel sold a majority of his remaining stake in Facebook Inc. last Thursday, a regulatory filing with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission has shown.
